title: The algorithm for diagnosis and management of intracranial hypotension with coma: Report of two cases
patient: A 61-year-old man with orthostatic headaches was transferred due to altered mental status. The brain MRI also showed deformation of the mesencephalon-midbrain due to severe brain sagging along with bilateral thick subdural hematomas. As a spinal CSF leak was suspected on the cervicothoracic MRI [], a myelo-CT was performed. When the myelo-CT demonstrated a microspur with dural leak ventrally at the T1/2 level; a targeted EBP was performed. Eighteen days later, when the orthostatic headaches and brain sagging recurred on the subsequent brain MRI, the patient underwent T1/T2 microspur removal with dural repair [- and ]. Six months postoperatively, the patient continued to do well.
